perturbation.original_text:
(a) Payments. In consideration for provision of the Content and all rights granted hereunder, Emdeon hereby agreed to pay WebMD the amounts
set forth on Exhibit B of this Agreement. All amounts payable shall be due be due thirty (30) days after the receipt of WebMD’s invoice.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) Payments. In consideration for provision of the Content and all rights granted hereunder, Emdeon hereby agreed to pay WebMD the amounts
set forth on Exhibit B of this Agreement. All amounts payable shall be due fifteen (15) days after the receipt of WebMD’s invoice.
perturbation.explanation: The change reduces the payment term to 15 days which could violate prompt payment laws in some states. Many states have laws that require payments to be made within a reasonable timeframe, and drastically shortening the payment period could be considered unreasonable and thus illegal.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State Prompt Payment Laws (example: NY Prompt Payment Law)

perturbation.original_text:
(c) Requirements. During the term of this Agreement and for so long as such information remains a trade secret under applicable law, neither party
will, except as otherwise expressly directed by the other
-5-
Source: WEBMD HEALTH CORP., S-1/A, 9/8/2005

 
party, use, copy, or disclose, or permit any unauthorized person access to, any of the other party’s Trade Secrets, except as expressly permitted
herein and necessary for accomplishment of activities required hereby. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of two (2) years after
termination hereof, neither party will use, copy, or disclose, or permit any unauthorized person access to, any of the other party’s Confidential
Information, except as expressly directed by such party or as permitted herein.
perturbation.changed_text:
(c) Requirements. During the term of this Agreement and for so long as such information remains a trade secret under applicable law, neither party
will, except as otherwise expressly directed by the other
-5-
Source: WEBMD HEALTH CORP., S-1/A, 9/8/2005

 
party, use, copy, or disclose, or permit any unauthorized person access to, any of the other party’s Trade Secrets, except as expressly permitted
herein and necessary for accomplishment of activities required hereby. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year after
termination hereof, neither party will use, copy, or disclose, or permit any unauthorized person access to, any of the other party’s Confidential
Information, except as expressly directed by such party or as permitted herein.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the confidentiality period for confidential information to one year after termination may be insufficient to protect sensitive information and trade secrets, especially if such information has a longer useful life. This may be seen as commercially unreasonable, and the definition of trade secrets lasts for as long as it is a trade secret under applicable law. Given the agreement is under New York law, the statute of limitations for misappropriation of trade secrets can be 3 years under the Defend Trade Secrets Act.

perturbation.original_text:
(a) Notices. All material notices and other communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and notices will be
deemed given three (3) days after they are sent by first class mail, return receipt requested, and one (1) day after they are sent by overnight courier
or upon receipt if delivered by hand delivery, to the receiving party’s address as set forth in the first paragraph above, or to such other address that
the receiving party may have provided in writing to the other party for purposes of receiving notices as provided in this Section.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) Notices. All material notices and other communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and notices will be
deemed given ten (10) days after they are sent by first class mail, return receipt requested, and one (1) day after they are sent by overnight courier
or upon receipt if delivered by hand delivery, to the receiving party’s address as set forth in the first paragraph above, or to such other address that
the receiving party may have provided in writing to the other party for purposes of receiving notices as provided in this Section.
perturbation.explanation: The changed text extends the deemed delivery time for notices sent via first class mail to ten days. This alteration contradicts standard commercial practices, which is often 3-5 days. This delay could impact the timely receipt of crucial information, leading to potential legal issues. For instance, if a critical notice is sent close to a contractual deadline, the delayed receipt could jeopardize a party's ability to meet its obligations.
